instructions: Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 4 1 Find the contact you want to edit on your Contacts list. You can look up your contact by their name, email, phone, company, or address. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 5 2 Hover over your contact's name on the list. You will now see the editing buttons on the right-hand side. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 6 3 Click the Image titled Android7star.png icon next to your contact's name. You can find it on the right-hand side. The star will turn blue, and the selected contact will be added to your "Starred Contacts" list. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 7 4 Click the Image titled Android7edit.png icon next to your contact's name. You can find it next to the star on the right-hand side. It will open the selected contact's details in a new pop-up. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 8 5 Edit your contact's information. You can add new details to this contact here or update their old information. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 9 6 Click on the bottom-right. This will update your contact's information. Advertisement

Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 10 1 Find the contact you want to edit on your Contacts list. You can look up your contact by their name, email, phone, company, or address. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 11 2 Hover over your contact's name on the list. You will now see the editing buttons on the right-hand side. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 12 3 Click the icon next to your contact's name. It's on the right-hand side. This will open all your contact options on a drop-down. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 13 4 Click on the menu. It's listed next to a trash icon. Alternatively, you can select Hide from contacts here. This option will hide the selected contact from the list here, but you can still easily add them to your emails. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 14 5 Click in the confirmation pop-up. This will confirm your action, and delete the selected contact from your Contacts list. Advertisement

Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 15 1 Find the contact you want to export or print. You can look up your contact by their name, email, phone, company, or address. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 16 2 Hover over your contact's name on the list. You will now see the editing buttons on the right-hand side. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 17 3 Click the icon next to your contact's name. It's on the right-hand side. This will open all your contact options on a drop-down. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 18 4 Click on the menu to export that contact. It's listed next to a cloud and arrow icon. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 19 5 Select an export format. You can export your contacts in Google CSV , Outlook CSV or vCard format. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 20 6 Click in the pop-up. This will export the selected contact, and save it to your computer's downloads folder. Advertisement

Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 21 1 Find the contact you want to export or print. You can look up your contact by their name, email, phone, company, or address. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 22 2 Hover over your contact's name on the list. You will now see the editing buttons on the right-hand side. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 23 3 Click the icon next to your contact's name. It will open your contact options. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 24 4 Click on the menu. This will open a print preview of the selected contact's information. Image titled Manage Contacts in Gmail Step 25 5 Click the blue button. This will print out the contact info from your printer. Advertisement
